original: Na upajjhāyaṁ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;🔽na ekaccassa cīvaraṁ dātabbaṁ, na ekaccassa cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ;🔽na ekaccassa parikkhāro dātabbo, na ekaccassa parikkhāro paṭiggahetabbo;
analyzed: na upajjhāyam anāpucchā ekaccassa pattaḥ dātabbaḥ na ekaccassa pattaḥ paṭiggahetabbo  na ekaccassa cīvaram dātabba na ekaccassa cīvaram paṭiggahetabba  na ekaccassa parikkhāraḥ dātabbaḥ na ekaccassa parikkhāraḥ paṭiggahetabbaḥ
translated: When washing a robe, he should carefully fold it, one fold only, and then carry it, keeping it close to his body. He shouldn’t walk in a place where there is a risk of running into other monks.🔽Without asking permission of his preceptor, he shouldn’t give his bowl or robe to anyone or have them given to him;🔽he shouldn’t carry anything for anyone or have it carried by anyone;

original: na ekaccassa kesā chedetabbā, na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā;🔽na ekaccassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ, na ekaccena parikammaṁ kārāpetabbaṁ;
analyzed: na ekaccassa kesā chedetabbā na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā  na ekaccassa parikammam kātabba na ekaccena parikammam kārāpetabba
translated: he shouldn’t cut anyone’s hair or have his hair cut;🔽he shouldn’t do any work for anyone or have work done by anyone;

original: na ekaccassa veyyāvacco kātabbo, na ekaccena veyyāvacco kārāpetabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa veyyāvaccaḥ kātabbaḥ na ekaccena veyyāvaccaḥ kārāpetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t do a service for anyone or have a service done by anyone;

original: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṁ, na ekacco pacchāsamaṇo ādātabbo;🔽na ekaccassa piṇḍapāto nīharitabbo, na ekaccena piṇḍapāto nīharāpetabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena na ekaccaḥ pacchāsamaṇaḥ ādātabbo  na ekaccassa piṇḍapātaḥ nīharitabbaḥ na ekaccena piṇḍapātaḥ nīharāpetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t walk behind your student.🔽You shouldn’t bring back almsfood for your student.

original: na upajjhāyaṁ anāpucchā gāmo pavisitabbo;
analyzed: na upajjhāyam an āpucchā gāmaḥ pavisitabbo
translated: You shouldn’t enter the village for alms without informing your teacher.

original: na susānaṁ gantabbaṁ;
analyzed: na su sānam
translated: You shouldn’t go to the charnel ground.

original: na disā pakkamitabbā.🔽Sace upajjhāyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṁ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṁ.
analyzed: na disā pakkamitabbā  sace upajjhāyaḥ gilānaḥ hoti yāvajīvam upaṭṭhātabbaḥ vuṭṭhānam assa āgametabba
translated: You shouldn’t go wandering in the countryside.🔽If your teacher is sick, you should nurse him for as long as he lives, and you shouldn’t leave him while he’s sick.”

original: Idaṁ kho, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikānaṁ upajjhāyesu vattaṁ yathā saddhivihārikehi upajjhāyesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
analyzed: idam kho bhikkhave saddhivihārikānam upajjhāyesu vattam yathā saddhivihārikehi upajjhāyesu sammā vattitabbanti
translated: “This is the proper conduct for students toward their teachers.”

original: 12. Saddhivihārikavattakathā
analyzed: saddhivihārika vatta kathā
translated: . The discussion of the proper conduct toward a student

original: Tena kho pana samayena upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena upajjhāyāḥ saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattanti
translated: At that time the teachers were not conducting themselves properly toward their students.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: Those monks who were modest … criticized and complained and spread it about:

original: “kathañhi nāma upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattissanti iti
translated: “How can teachers not conduct themselves properly toward their students?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: The monks told the Buddha. …

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattanti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the preceptors aren’t acting properly with respect to their students?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti …pe…
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati pe
translated: “It’s true, Sir.” …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, upajjhāyānaṁ saddhivihārikesu vattaṁ paññapessāmi yathā upajjhāyehi saddhivihārikesu sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave upajjhāyānam saddhivihārikesu vattam paññapessāmi yathā upajjhāyehi saddhivihārikesu sammā vattitabba
translated: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct for preceptors toward their students.

original: Upajjhāyena, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikamhi sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: upajjhāyena bhikkhave saddhivihārikamhi sammā
translated: A preceptor should conduct himself properly toward his student.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā
translated: This is the proper conduct:

original: Upajjhāyena, bhikkhave, saddhivihāriko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
analyzed: upajjhāyena bhikkhave saddhivihārikaḥ saṅgahetabbaḥ anuggahetabbaḥ uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā
translated: A preceptor should support his student and look after him, teaching him and instructing him.

original: Sace upajjhāyassa patto hoti, saddhivihārikassa patto na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace upajjhāyassa pattaḥ hoti saddhivihārikassa pattaḥ na hoti upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa pattaḥ dātabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the preceptor has a bowl, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him or make an effort to get him one.

original: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa pattaḥ uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my student get a bowl?’

original: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṁ hoti, saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ dātabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace upajjhāyassa cīvaram hoti saddhivihārikassa cīvaram na hoti upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa cīvaram dātabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the preceptor has a robe but the student doesn’t, the preceptor should give the student the robe or make an effort to get him one.

original: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaram uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my student get a robe?’

original: Sace upajjhāyassa parikkhāro hoti, saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace upajjhāyassa parikkhāraḥ hoti saddhivihārikassa parikkhāraḥ na hoti upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa parikkhāraḥ dātabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the preceptor has a requisite but the student doesn’t, the preceptor should give the student the requisite or make an effort to get him one.

original: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa parikkhāraḥ uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my student get a requisite?’

original: Sace saddhivihāriko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṁ dātabbaṁ, mukhodakaṁ dātabbaṁ, āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikaḥ gilānaḥ hoti kālassa iva uṭṭhāya danta kaṭṭham dātabba mukha udakam dātabba āsanam paññapetabba
translated: If the student is sick, the preceptor should get up at the appropriate time, chew his tooth stick, wash his face, and prepare a seat.

original: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṁ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
analyzed: sace yāgu hoti bhājanam dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā
translated: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to the student.

original: Yāguṁ pītassa udakaṁ datvā bhājanaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: yāgum pītassa udakam datvā bhājanam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam a paṭigha santena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabba
translated: After he has drunk rice porridge, the water container should be given to him. After receiving the bowl, he should wash it well without scratching it and then put it away.

original: Saddhivihārikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: saddhivihārikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba
translated: When the student gets up, the teacher should put away the seat.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko gāmaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ,
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo  sace saddhivihārikaḥ gāmam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti nivāsanam dātabba paṭinivāsanam paṭiggahetabba
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the student wants to enter the village, he should be given a sarong and a upper robe.

original: kāyabandhanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
analyzed: kāya bandhanam sa guṇam katvā saṅghāṭiyaḥ dātabbāḥ dhovitvā pattaḥ sa udakaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: The teacher should fasten the waistband and give him the upper robes, well-arranged. After washing it, he should give him a bowl that is free from nits.

original: Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ
analyzed: ettāvatā nivattissati iti āsanam pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalika
translated: When he thinks, “He will return at this time,” the teacher should prepare a seat, set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: upanikkhipitabbaṁ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ,🔽nivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: upanikkhipitabba paccuggantvā patta cīvaram paṭiggahetabba paṭinivāsanam dātabba  nivāsanam paṭiggahetabba
translated: After going out to meet him, he should receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

original: Sace cīvaraṁ sinnaṁ hoti, muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbaṁ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṁ nidahitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace cīvaram sinnam hoti muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabba na ca uṇhe cīvaram nidahitabba
translated: If the robe is moist, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

original: Cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram
translated: The robe should be folded evenly.

original: Cīvaraṁ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṁ kaṇṇaṁ ussāretvā cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ—
analyzed: cīvaram saṅgharantena catur aṅgulam kaṇṇam ussāretvā cīvaram
translated: When folding the robe, you should leave out four fingerbreadths so that

original: mā majjhe bhaṅgo ahosīti.
analyzed: mā majjhe bhaṅgaḥ ahosi iti
translated: the middle fold doesn’t break.

original: Obhoge kāyabandhanaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: obhoge kāyabandhanam
translated: The belt should be put away.

original: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, saddhivihāriko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṁ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
analyzed: sace piṇḍapātaḥ hoti saddhivihārikaḥ ca bhuñjitu kāmaḥ hoti udakam datvā piṇḍapātaḥ upanāmetabbo
translated: If there is almsfood and if the pupil wants to eat, you should give him water and then the almsfood.

original: Saddhivihāriko pānīyena pucchitabbo.
analyzed: saddhivihārikaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo
translated: You should ask him if he wants water to drink.

original: Bhuttāvissa udakaṁ datvā pattaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā vodakaṁ katvā muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
analyzed: bhuttāvissa udakam datvā pattam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena dhovitvā vā udakam katvā muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabbaḥ na ca uṇhe pattaḥ nidahitabbaḥ
translated: After he has eaten, you should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, you should wash it carefully without scratching it. You should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but you should not leave it in the heat.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: patta cīvaram
translated: You should put away the robe and bowl.

original: Pattaṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṁ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṁ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: pattam nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattam gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcam vā heṭṭhā pīṭham vā parāmasitvā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: When putting away the bowl, you should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or under the bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: na ca anantara hitāya bhūmiyā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbo
translated: You should not put away the bowl on the bare ground.

original: Cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṁsaṁ vā cīvararajjuṁ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaram gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvara vasam vā cīvara rajjum vā pamajjitvā pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram nikkhipitabba
translated: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, feel under the bed or bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Saddhivihārikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: saddhivihārikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam paṭisāmetabba
translated: When the student has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat and also the foot stool and the foot scraper.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.🔽Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo  sace saddhivihārikaḥ nahāyitu kāmaḥ hoti nahānam  sace sītena atthaḥ hoti sītam
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the student wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare a bath.

original: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace uṇhena atthaḥ hoti uṇham
translated: If he wants a hot bath, he should prepare a hot bath.🔽If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare a cold bath.

original: Sace saddhivihāriko jantāgharaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṁ sannetabbaṁ, mattikā temetabbā,
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikaḥ jantāgharam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti cuṇṇam sannetabba mattikā temetabbā
translated: If the student wants to take a sauna, the teacher should knead bath powder, moisten the clay,

original: jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṁ datvā cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṁ
analyzed: jantāghara pīṭham ādāya gantvā jantāghara pīṭham da tvā cīvaram paṭiggahetvā ekamanta
translated: take the sauna bench, and give it to him. After receiving the robe, he should put it to one side

original: nikkhipitabbaṁ, cuṇṇaṁ dātabbaṁ, mattikā dātabbā.
analyzed: nikkhipitabba cuṇṇam dātabba mattikā dātabbā
translated: and then give him the bath powder and the clay.

original: Sace ussahati jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace ussahati jantāgharam
translated: If he is able, he should enter the sauna.

original: Jantāgharaṁ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṁ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharam pavisantena mattikāya mukham makkhetvā puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharam pavisitabba
translated: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter the sauna.

original: Na there bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīditabbaṁ, na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā.
analyzed: na there bhikkhū an upakhajja nisīditabba na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā
translated: He should not sit encroaching on the senior monks, nor should he block the junior monks from getting a seat.

original: Jantāghare saddhivihārikassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāghare saddhivihārikassa parikammam
translated: He should do services for his companion in the sauna.

original: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāghara pīṭham ādāya puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabba
translated: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench and, covering himself front and back, leave the sauna.

original: Udakepi saddhivihārikassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.🔽Nahātena paṭhamataraṁ uttaritvā attano gattaṁ vodakaṁ katvā nivāsetvā saddhivihārikassa
analyzed: udake pi saddhivihārikassa parikammam  nahātena paṭhamataram uttaritvā attanaḥ gattam vā udakam katvā nivāsetvā saddhivihārikassa
translated: He should do services for his companion in the water.🔽When bathing, he should come out first, dry himself, and put on his sarong.

original: gattato udakaṁ pamajjitabbaṁ, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṁ
analyzed: udakam pamajjitabba nivāsanam dātabba saṅghāṭi dātabbā jantāghara pīṭha
translated: He should then wipe the water off his companion’s body, give him his sarong, give him his upper robe, and give him the sauna bench.

original: ādāya paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ upanikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ādāya paṭhamataram āgantvā āsanam paññapetabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam upanikkhipitabba
translated: He should prepare a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: Saddhivihāriko pānīyena pucchitabbo.
analyzed: saddhivihārikaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo
translated: He should ask his student if he wants water to drink.

original: Yasmiṁ vihāre saddhivihāriko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
analyzed: yasmin vihāre saddhivihārikaḥ viharati sace saḥ vihāraḥ uklāpaḥ hoti sace ussahati sodhetabbo
translated: If the dwelling where the student is staying is dirty, the preceptor should clean it if he’s able to.

original: Vihāraṁ sodhentena paṭhamaṁ pattacīvaraṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ …pe…
analyzed: vihāram sodhentena paṭhamam patta cīvaram nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbam pe
translated: When cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

original: sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ āsiñcitabbaṁ.🔽Sace saddhivihārikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, upajjhāyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam na hoti ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam  sace saddhivihārikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti upajjhāyena vūpakāsetabbaḥ vūpakāsāpetabbaḥ dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If there is no water in the rinsing water pot, he should fill it up.🔽If the student is dissatisfied, the preceptor should allay it or make an effort to get it allaid. If the student has developed a bad view, he should make an effort to have it relinquished.

original: Sace saddhivihārikassa kukkuccaṁ uppannaṁ hoti, upajjhāyena vinodetabbaṁ, vinodāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikassa kukkuccam uppannam hoti upajjhāyena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If the student has committed a heavy offense and hasn’t been dealt with, the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to deal with him.🔽If the student is insane, the preceptor should take care of him or make an effort to get someone else to do so.

original: Sace saddhivihārikassa diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti, upajjhāyena vivecetabbaṁ, vivecāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko garudhammaṁ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, upajjhāyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikassa diṭṭhi gatam uppannam hoti upajjhāyena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace saddhivihārikaḥ garu dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaḥ hoti parivāsa arahaḥ upajjhāyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil has wrong view, the preceptor should try to make him give it up or get others to make him give it up, or he should explain the Teaching to him.

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa parivāsaṁ dadeyyāti.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ saddhivihārikassa parivāsam dadeyya ati  sace saddhivihārikaḥ mūlāya paṭikassana arahaḥ hoti upajjhāyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation, the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikaṁ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko mānattāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa mānattaṁ dadeyyāti.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko abbhānāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ saddhivihārikam mūlāya paṭikasseyya ati  sace saddhivihārikaḥ mānatta arahaḥ hoti upajjhāyena ussukkam kātabba  kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ saddhivihārikassa mānattam dadeyya ati  sace saddhivihārikaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ hoti upajjhāyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil deserves to be sent back to the beginning, the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to do this.🔽If the pupil deserves the trial period, the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikaṁ abbheyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ saddhivihārikam abbheyyāti
translated: If the pupil deserves rehabilitation, the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to do this.

original: Sace saṅgho saddhivihārikassa kammaṁ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, upajjhāyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace saṅghaḥ saddhivihārikassa kammam kattu kāmo hoti tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā upajjhāyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against the pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa kammaṁ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ saddhivihārikassa kammam na kareyya lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyya ati
translated: the preceptor should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

original: Kataṁ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṁ, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā, ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, upajjhāyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: katam vā pana assa hoti saṅghena kamma tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā upajjhāyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the Sangha has done a legal procedure against the pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

original: kinti nu kho saddhivihāriko sammā vatteyya lomaṁ pāteyya, netthāraṁ vatteyya, saṅgho taṁ kammaṁ paṭippassambheyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikaḥ sammā vatteyya lomam pāteyya netthāram vatteyya saṅghaḥ tam kammam paṭippassambheyya ati
translated: the preceptor should make an effort to help the pupil conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and to help the Sangha lift that procedure.

original: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ dhovitabbaṁ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—evaṁ dhoveyyāsīti,
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaram dhovitabbam hoti upajjhāyena ācikkhitabba evam dhoveyyāsi iti
translated: If the pupil’s robe needs washing, the preceptor should show him how it’s done,

original: ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ dhoviyethāti.
analyzed: ussukkam vā nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaram
translated: or make an effort to find someone else to show him.

original: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ kātabbaṁ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—evaṁ kareyyāsīti,🔽ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ kariyethāti.
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaram kātabbam hoti upajjhāyena ācikkhitabba evam kareyyāsi iti  ussukkam vā nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaram kariyetha ati
translated: If the student needs a robe, the preceptor should explain to him how to make one or should make an effort to get him robe-cloth or to find someone to make him a robe.

original: Sace saddhivihārikassa rajanaṁ pacitabbaṁ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—evaṁ paceyyāsīti,🔽ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa rajanaṁ paciyethāti.🔽Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ rajitabbaṁ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—evaṁ rajeyyāsīti,
analyzed: sace saddhivihārikassa rajanam pacitabbam hoti upajjhāyena ācikkhitabba evam paceyyāsi iti  ussukkam vā nu kho saddhivihārikassa rajanam  sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaram rajitabbam hoti upajjhāyena ācikkhitabba evam rajeyyāsi iti
translated: If the student needs dye, the preceptor should explain to him how to make it or should make an effort to get him dye or to find someone to make dye for him.

original: ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṁ rajiyethāti.
analyzed: ussukkam vā nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaram rajiyetha ati
translated: If the student needs to dye his robe, the preceptor should explain to him how to do it or should make an effort to get him a dyer or to find someone to dye the robe.

original: Cīvaraṁ rajantena sādhukaṁ samparivattakaṁ samparivattakaṁ rajitabbaṁ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṁ.🔽Sace saddhivihāriko gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṁ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram rajantena sādhukam samparivattakam samparivattakam rajitabba na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabba 🔽sace saddhivihārikaḥ gilānaḥ hoti yāvajīvam upaṭṭhātabbaḥ vuṭṭhānam assa āgametabba
translated: When dyeing the robe, he should carefully turn it end to end, and he should not leave while it is still dripping.🔽If the student is sick, the preceptor should nurse him as long as he lives or until he recovers, and he should not leave him while he is still sick.

original: Idaṁ kho, bhikkhave, upajjhāyānaṁ saddhivihārikesu vattaṁ yathā upajjhāyehi saddhivihārikesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
analyzed: idam kho bhikkhave upajjhāyānam saddhivihārikesu vattam yathā upajjhāyehi saddhivihārikesu sammā vattitabbanti
translated: This is the proper conduct for preceptors toward their students.”

original: Dutiyabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito.
analyzed: dutiya bhāṇa vāraḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The second section for recitation is finished.

original: 13. Ācariyavattakathā
analyzed: ācariyavatta kathā
translated: The training rules on teachers

original: Tena kho pana samayena antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena antevāsikāḥ ācariyesu na sammā vattanti
translated: At that time the pupils were not conducting themselves properly toward their teachers.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma antevāsikāḥ ācariyesu na sammā vattissanti iti
translated: “How can pupils not conduct themselves properly toward their teachers?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave antevāsikāḥ ācariyesu na sammā vattanti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that pupils are not conducting themselves properly toward their teachers?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti …pe…
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati pe
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, antevāsikānaṁ ācariyesu vattaṁ paññapessāmi yathā antevāsikehi ācariyesu sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave antevāsikānam ācariyesu vattam paññapessāmi yathā antevāsikehi ācariyesu sammā vattitabba
translated: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct for pupils toward their teachers.

original: Antevāsikena, bhikkhave, ācariyamhi sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: antevāsikena bhikkhave ācariyamhi sammā
translated: A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā
translated: This is the proper conduct:

original: Kālasseva uṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṁ dātabbaṁ, mukhodakaṁ dātabbaṁ, āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: kālassa iva uṭṭhāya upāhanāḥ omuñcitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā danta kaṭṭham dātabba mukha udakam dātabba āsanam paññapetabba
translated: After getting up early, he should take off his sandals and put his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his teacher a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

original: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṁ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
analyzed: sace yāgu hoti bhājanam dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā
translated: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to his teacher.

original: Yāguṁ pītassa udakaṁ datvā bhājanaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: yāgum pītassa udakam datvā bhājanam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam a paṭigha santena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabba
translated: When the teacher has drunk the rice porridge, the pupil should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it aside.

original: Ācariyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ācariyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam
translated: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace ācariyo gāmaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, kāyabandhanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ gāmam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti nivāsanam dātabba paṭinivāsanam paṭiggahetabba kāya bandhanam dātabba sa guṇam katvā saṅghāṭiyaḥ dātabbā dhovitvā pattaḥ sa udakaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: If the teacher wants to enter the village, the pupil should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should wash his teacher’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

original: Sace ācariyo pacchāsamaṇaṁ ākaṅkhati, timaṇḍalaṁ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṁ nivāsetvā
analyzed: sace ācariyo pacchā samaṇam ākaṅkhati timaṇḍalam paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalam nivāsetvā
translated: If the teacher wants a pupil to follow behind him, he should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees.

original: kāyabandhanaṁ bandhitvā saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṁ paṭimuñcitvā🔽dhovitvā pattaṁ gahetvā ācariyassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṁ.
analyzed: kāya bandhanam bandhitvā sa guṇam katvā saṅghāṭiyaḥ pārupitvā gaṇṭhikam paṭimuñcitvā  dhovitvā pattam gahetvā ācariyassa pacchā samaṇena
translated: He should put on a belt. He should put on an upper robe that covers the three circles. He should fasten the waistband.

original: Nātidūre gantabbaṁ, nāccāsanne gantabbaṁ, pattapariyāpannaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: na atidūre gantabba na acca āsanne gantabba patta pariyāpannam paṭiggahetabba
translated: He should wash his bowl and bring it along. He should follow behind his teacher, keeping him within arm’s reach, neither too far behind nor too close. He should receive the teacher’s almsfood in his bowl.

original: Na ācariyassa bhaṇamānassa antarantarā kathā opātetabbā.
analyzed: na ācariyassa bhaṇamānassa antarantarā kathā opātetabbā
translated: He should not interrupt the teacher when he is speaking.

original: Ācariyo āpattisāmantā bhaṇamāno nivāretabbo.🔽Nivattantena paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ
analyzed: ācariyaḥ āpatti sāmantā bhaṇamānaḥ nivāretabbaḥ  nivattantena paṭhamataram āgantvā āsanam paññapetabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalika
translated: If the teacher speaks contrary to the Teaching, the pupil should stop him.🔽When turning back, the pupil should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: upanikkhipitabbaṁ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ,
analyzed: upanikkhipitabba paccuggantvā patta cīvaram paṭiggahetabba paṭinivāsanam dātabba
translated: He should go out to meet the teacher to receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

original: nivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: nivāsanam paṭiggahetabba
translated: He should wash the teacher’s bowl.

original: Sace cīvaraṁ sinnaṁ hoti, muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbaṁ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṁ nidahitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace cīvaram sinnam hoti muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabba na ca uṇhe cīvaram nidahitabba
translated: If the robe is moist, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

original: Cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ.🔽Cīvaraṁ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṁ kaṇṇaṁ ussāretvā cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ—
analyzed: cīvaram  cīvaram saṅgharantena catur aṅgulam kaṇṇam ussāretvā cīvaram
translated: The robe should be folded.

original: mā majjhe bhaṅgo ahosīti.
analyzed: mā majjhe bhaṅgaḥ ahosi iti
translated: When folding the robe, you should leave out four fingerbreadths all around so that it doesn’t get creased in the middle.

original: Obhoge kāyabandhanaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: obhoge kāyabandhanam
translated: The belt should be put away.

original: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, ācariyo ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṁ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
analyzed: sace piṇḍapātaḥ hoti ācariyaḥ ca bhuñjitu kāmaḥ hoti udakam datvā piṇḍapātaḥ upanāmetabbo
translated: If there is almsfood and your teacher wants to eat, you should give him water and then the almsfood.

original: Ācariyo pānīyena pucchitabbo.
analyzed: ācariyaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo
translated: You should ask your teacher if he wants water to drink.

original: Bhuttāvissa udakaṁ datvā pattaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā vodakaṁ katvā muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
analyzed: bhuttāvissa udakam datvā pattam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena dhovitvā vā udakam katvā muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabbaḥ na ca uṇhe pattaḥ nidahitabbaḥ
translated: After the meal, you should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, you should wash it carefully without scratching it. You should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but you should not leave it in the heat.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: patta cīvaram
translated: You should put away the robe and bowl.

original: Pattaṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṁ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṁ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: pattam nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattam gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcam vā heṭṭhā pīṭham vā parāmasitvā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: When putting away the bowl, you should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or under the bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: na ca anantara hitāya bhūmiyā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbo
translated: You should not put the bowl away on the bare ground.

original: Cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṁsaṁ vā cīvararajjuṁ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaram gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvara vasam vā cīvara rajjum vā pamajjitvā pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram nikkhipitabba
translated: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe with one hand, stroke the bamboo robe rack or cord with the other, pick up the robe with both hands, and put it away.

original: Ācariyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ācariyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam paṭisāmetabba
translated: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat and also the foot stool and the foot scraper.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.🔽Sace ācariyo nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo  sace ācariyaḥ nahāyitu kāmaḥ hoti nahānam
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the teacher wants to bathe, the pupil should prepare the bath.

original: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace sītena atthaḥ hoti sītam
translated: If he wants it cold, the pupil should make it cold.

original: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace uṇhena atthaḥ hoti uṇham
translated: If he wants it hot, the pupil should heat it up.

original: Sace ācariyo jantāgharaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṁ sannetabbaṁ, mattikā temetabbā,
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ jantāgharam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti cuṇṇam sannetabba mattikā temetabbā
translated: If the teacher wants to take a sauna, the pupil should knead bath powder, moisten the clay,

original: jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya ācariyassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṁ datvā
analyzed: jantāghara pīṭham ādāya ācariyassa piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ gantvā jantāghara pīṭham da tvā
translated: take the sauna bench, and follow behind the teacher. After giving the teacher the sauna bench, taking the sauna towel in his left hand, and holding the sauna whisk in his right hand, he should fan the teacher.

original: cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ, cuṇṇaṁ dātabbaṁ, mattikā dātabbā.
analyzed: cīvaram paṭiggahetvā eka mantam nikkhipitabba cuṇṇam dātabba mattikā dātabbā
translated: After receiving the robe, he should put it aside and give the preceptor powder and soap.

original: Sace ussahati, jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace ussahati jantāgharam
translated: If he is able, he should enter the sauna.

original: Jantāgharaṁ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṁ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.🔽Na there bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīditabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharam pavisantena mattikāya mukham makkhetvā puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharam pavisitabba  na there bhikkhū an upakhajja nisīditabba
translated: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter the sauna.🔽He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

original: Na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā.🔽Jantāghare ācariyassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā  jantāghare ācariyassa parikammam
translated: nor should he block the junior monks from getting a seat.🔽He should do services for his preceptor in the sauna.

original: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāghara pīṭham ādāya puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabba
translated: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench and, covering himself front and back, leave the sauna.

original: Udakepi ācariyassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: udake pi ācariyassa parikammam
translated: He should do services for his preceptor in the water.🔽When bathing, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong.

original: Nahātena paṭhamataraṁ uttaritvā attano gattaṁ vodakaṁ katvā nivāsetvā ācariyassa
analyzed: nahātena paṭhamataram uttaritvā attanaḥ gattam vā udakam katvā nivāsetvā ācariyassa
translated: He should then wipe the water off his preceptor’s body,

original: gattato udakaṁ pamajjitabbaṁ, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṁ
analyzed: udakam pamajjitabba nivāsanam dātabba saṅghāṭi dātabbā jantāghara pīṭha
translated: give him his sarong and then his upper robe, and also give him the sauna bench.

original: ādāya paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ upanikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ādāya paṭhamataram āgantvā āsanam paññapetabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam upanikkhipitabba
translated: “Having taken them, he should prepare a seat, set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: Ācariyo pānīyena pucchitabbo.🔽Sace uddisāpetukāmo hoti, uddisitabbo.
analyzed: ācariyaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo  sace uddisā apetu kāmaḥ hoti uddisitabbaḥ
translated: “He should ask the teacher if he wants water for drinking.🔽“If he wants to recite, he should recite.

original: Sace paripucchitukāmo hoti, paripucchitabbo.
analyzed: sace paripucchitu kāmaḥ hoti paripucchitabbaḥ
translated: “If he wants to ask about the Teaching, he should ask about the Teaching.

original: Yasmiṁ vihāre ācariyo viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.🔽Vihāraṁ sodhentena paṭhamaṁ pattacīvaraṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;
analyzed: yasmin vihāre ācariyaḥ viharati sace saḥ vihāraḥ uklāpaḥ hoti sace ussahati sodhetabbo  vihāram sodhentena paṭhamam patta cīvaram nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabba
translated: “If the dwelling where the teacher is staying is dirty, the student should clean it if he’s able.🔽“In cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robes and put them aside.

original: nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;🔽bhisibibbohanaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;
analyzed: nisīdana paccattharaṇam nīharitvā ekamantam  bhisi bibbohanam nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba
translated: “He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet for sitting on and put them aside.🔽“He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

original: mañco nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbo;
analyzed: mañcaḥ nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: “Lowering the bed, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

original: pīṭhaṁ nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;
analyzed: pīṭham nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba
translated: He should lower the bench and take it out carefully, without scraping it or knocking it against the door or the door frame. He should put it to one side.

original: mañcapaṭipādakā nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbā;
analyzed: mañca paṭipādakā nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbā
translated: He should take out the bed supports and put them to one side.

original: kheḷamallako nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbo;🔽apassenaphalakaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;
analyzed: kheḷa mallakaḥ nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbaḥ  a passena phalakam nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba
translated: He should take out the bed base and put it to one side.🔽He should take out the frame for the bed base and put it to one side.

original: bhūmattharaṇaṁ yathāpaññattaṁ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.🔽Sace vihāre santānakaṁ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṁ ohāretabbaṁ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
analyzed: bhūmattharaṇam yathāpaññattam sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba  sace vihāre santānakam hoti ullokā paṭhamam ohāretabbaḥ āloka sandhi kaṇṇa bhāgā pamajjitabbā
translated: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them to one side.🔽If there is a mosquito screen, he should take it down and put it to one side.

original: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṁ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.🔽Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṁ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace geruka parikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti coḷakam temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā  sace kāḷavaṇṇaka tā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti coḷakam temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā
translated: If the wall has been treated with red ocher and it is moldy, he should wipe it dry with a cloth.🔽If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it is moldy, he should wipe it dry with a cloth.

original: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
analyzed: sace akatā hoti bhūmi udakena paripphositvā paripphositvā sammajjitabbā
translated: If the floor has not been treated with a black finish, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it, but only after first checking whether there are any living beings on it.

original: mā vihāro rajena uhaññīti.
analyzed: mā vihāraḥ rajena uhaññī iti
translated: So that the dwelling doesn’t get dirty.”

original: Saṅkāraṁ vicinitvā ekamantaṁ chaḍḍetabbaṁ.🔽Bhūmattharaṇaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: saṅkāram vicinitvā ekamantam  bhūmattharaṇam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba
translated: After looking for trash, it should be discarded in a suitable place.🔽The floor cover should be taken out, cleaned, shaken out, brought back, and put away as it was before.

original: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.🔽Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbo.
analyzed: mañca paṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā  mañcaḥ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabbaḥ
translated: The bed supports should be cleaned, wiped, brought back, and put in their proper place.

original: Pīṭhaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pīṭham otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba
translated: The bed should be taken apart, cleaned, wiped, brought back, and put together as it was before, carefully and without hurrying, so that the bedposts don’t get damaged and the bed frame doesn’t get dented.🔽The bench should be taken apart, cleaned, wiped, brought back, and put together as it was before, carefully and without hurrying, so that the bench-legs don’t get damaged and the bench frame doesn’t get dented.

original: Bhisibibbohanaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: bhisi bibbohanam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba
translated: The mattress and pillow should be taken out, cleaned, shaken out, brought back, and put away as they were before.

original: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
analyzed: nisīdana paccattharaṇam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  kheḷamallakaḥ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo
translated: After taking out the sitting mat and the sheet to sit on, he should sun them, dust them off, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.🔽After taking out the spittoon, he should sun it, dust it off, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

original: Apassenaphalakaṁ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: a passena phalakam otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabba
translated: After taking out the leaning board, he should sun it, dust it off, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: patta cīvaram
translated: He should put away the bowl and robe.

original: Pattaṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṁ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṁ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: pattam nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattam gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcam vā heṭṭhā pīṭham vā parāmasitvā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, run his other hand under the bed or under the bench, and then put it away.

original: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: na ca anantara hitāya bhūmiyā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbo
translated: He should not put away the bowl without first making sure that there is nothing fragile there.🔽When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, pat the furniture with the other, and then put it away.

original: Cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṁsaṁ vā cīvararajjuṁ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaram gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvara vasam vā cīvara rajjum vā pamajjitvā pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram nikkhipitabba
translated: He should not put away the robe without first making sure that there is nothing fragile there.

original: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
analyzed: sace puratthimā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti puratthimā vāta pānā thaketabbā
translated: If the eastern side is dusty, he should wipe the eastern windows and the eastern part of the porch.

original: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
analyzed: sace pacchimā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti pacchimā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace uttarā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti uttarā vāta pānā thaketabbā
translated: If the wind is coming from the west, the western windows should be closed.🔽If the wind is coming from the north, the northern windows should be closed.

original: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṁ thaketabbā.🔽Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṁ vivaritabbā.
analyzed: sace dakkhiṇā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti dakkhiṇā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace sīta kālaḥ hoti divā vāta pānā vivaritabbā rattim thaketabbā  sace uṇha kālaḥ hoti divā vāta pānā thaketabbā rattim vivaritabbā
translated: If the wind is coming from the south, the southern windows should be closed.🔽If it’s cold, the windows should be opened during the day and closed at night.🔽If it’s hot, the windows should be closed during the day and opened at night.

original: Sace pariveṇaṁ uklāpaṁ hoti, pariveṇaṁ sammajjitabbaṁ.🔽Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
analyzed: sace pariveṇam uklāpam hoti pariveṇam sammajjitabba  sace koṭṭhakaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti koṭṭhakaḥ sammajjitabbaḥ
translated: If the yard is dirty, it should be swept.🔽If the sauna is dirty, it should be swept.

original: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.🔽Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace upaṭṭhāna sālā uklāpā hoti upaṭṭhāna sālā sammajjitabbā  sace aggi sālā uklāpā hoti aggi sālā sammajjitabbā
translated: If the assembly hall is dirty, it should be swept.🔽If the fire hut is dirty, it should be swept.

original: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā
translated: If the restroom is dirty, it should be swept.

original: Sace pānīyaṁ na hoti, pānīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace pānīyam na hoti pānīyam upaṭṭhāpetabba
translated: If there is no drinking water, drinking water should be brought.

original: Sace paribhojanīyaṁ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ.🔽Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ āsiñcitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace paribhojanīyam na hoti paribhojanīyam upaṭṭhāpetabba  sace ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam na hoti ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam
translated: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should fill it up.🔽If the teacher has developed a desire to travel, the pupil should help him prepare his requisites.🔽If the teacher is sick, the pupil should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he has recovered.

original: Sace ācariyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, antevāsikena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace ācariyassa kukkuccaṁ uppannaṁ hoti, antevāsikena vinodetabbaṁ, vinodāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace ācariyassa diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti, antevāsikena vivecetabbaṁ, vivecāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace ācariyo garudhammaṁ ajjhāpanno hoti, parivāsāraho, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti antevāsikena vūpakāsetabbaḥ vūpakāsāpetabbaḥ dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace ācariyassa kukkuccam uppannam hoti antevāsikena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace ācariyassa diṭṭhi gatam uppannam hoti antevāsikena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace ācariyaḥ garu dhammam ajjhāpannaḥ hoti parivāsa arahaḥ antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the teacher has died, the pupil should do what is proper for a disciple in regard to the teacher.🔽If the teacher has been ejected for not recognizing an offense, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha lift that restriction on the teacher?’🔽If the teacher has been ejected for not making amends for an offense, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha lift that restriction on the teacher?’🔽If the teacher has been ejected for not giving up a bad view, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha lift that restriction on the teacher?’

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa parivāsaṁ dadeyyāti.🔽Sace ācariyo mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyassa parivāsam dadeyya ati 🔽sace ācariyaḥ mūlāya paṭikassana arahaḥ hoti antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the teacher is deserving of the trial period, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha give the teacher the trial period?’🔽If the teacher is deserving of rehabilitation, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha rehabilitate the teacher?’

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṁ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyam mūlāya paṭikasseyya ati
translated: ‘How can the Sangha send my teacher back to the beginning?’

original: Sace ācariyo mānattāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ mānatta arahaḥ hoti antevāsikena ussukkam
translated: If the teacher deserves the trial period, the pupil should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa mānattaṁ dadeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyassa mānattam dadeyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha give my teacher the trial period?’

original: Sace ācariyo abbhānāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ hoti antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the teacher deserves rehabilitation, the pupil should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṁ abbheyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyam abbheyyāti
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha rehabilitate my teacher?’

original: Sace saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṁ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace saṅghaḥ ācariyassa kammam kattu kāmo hoti tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—the pupil should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṁ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyassa kammam na kareyya lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha not do that procedure? Or how can it do a lighter one?’

original: Kataṁ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṁ, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: katam vā pana assa hoti saṅghena kamma tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: But if the Sangha has done a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—the pupil should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho ācariyo sammā vatteyya, lomaṁ pāteyya, netthāraṁ vatteyya, saṅgho taṁ kammaṁ paṭippassambheyyāti.🔽Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ dhovitabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena dhovitabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyaḥ sammā vatteyya lomam pāteyya netthāram vatteyya saṅghaḥ tam kammam paṭippassambheyya ati  sace ācariyassa cīvaram dhovitabbam hoti antevāsikena dhovitabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: ‘How can the teacher behave properly, lower his hackles, mend his ways, so that the Sangha will lift that procedure?’

original: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṁ dhoviyethāti.🔽Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ kātabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena kātabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṁ kariyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaram dhoviyetha ati  sace ācariyassa cīvaram kātabbam hoti antevāsikena kātabba ussukkam vā kātabba  kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaram kariyetha ati
translated: If the teacher’s robe needs washing, the pupil should do it himself, or he should make an effort, ‘How can my teacher’s robe be washed?’🔽If the teacher’s robe needs making, the pupil should do it himself, or he should make an effort, ‘How can my teacher’s robe be made?’

original: Sace ācariyassa rajanaṁ pacitabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena pacitabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho ācariyassa rajanaṁ paciyethāti.🔽Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ rajitabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena rajitabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa rajanam pacitabbam hoti antevāsikena pacitabba ussukkam vā kātabba  kinti nu kho ācariyassa rajanam  sace ācariyassa cīvaram rajitabbam hoti antevāsikena rajitabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher needs dye, the pupil should make it himself, or he should make an effort, ‘How can dye be made for my teacher?’

original: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṁ rajiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaram rajiyetha ati
translated: If the teacher’s robe needs dyeing, the pupil should do it himself, or he should make an effort, ‘How can my teacher’s robe be dyed?’

original: Cīvaraṁ rajantena sādhukaṁ samparivattakaṁ samparivattakaṁ rajitabbaṁ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram rajantena sādhukam samparivattakam samparivattakam rajitabba na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabba
translated: When dyeing robes, he should dye them carefully, turning them over and over again, and he should not leave while they are still dripping.

original: Na ācariyaṁ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;🔽na ekaccassa cīvaraṁ dātabbaṁ, na ekaccassa cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ;🔽na ekaccassa parikkhāro dātabbo, na ekaccassa parikkhāro paṭiggahetabbo;
analyzed: na ācariyam anāpucchā ekaccassa pattaḥ dātabbaḥ na ekaccassa pattaḥ paṭiggahetabbo  na ekaccassa cīvaram dātabba na ekaccassa cīvaram paṭiggahetabba  na ekaccassa parikkhāraḥ dātabbaḥ na ekaccassa parikkhāraḥ paṭiggahetabbaḥ
translated: He should not give away or receive back a bowl without the teacher’s permission.🔽He should not give away or receive back a robe without the teacher’s permission.🔽He should not give away or receive back a requisite without the teacher’s permission.

original: na ekaccassa kesā cheditabbā, na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā;🔽na ekaccassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ, na ekaccena parikammaṁ kārāpetabbaṁ;🔽na ekaccassa veyyāvacco kātabbo, na ekaccena veyyāvacco kārāpetabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa kesā cheditabbā na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā  na ekaccassa parikammam kātabba na ekaccena parikammam kārāpetabba  na ekaccassa veyyāvaccaḥ kātabbaḥ na ekaccena veyyāvaccaḥ kārāpetabbaḥ
translated: He should not cut his teacher’s hair or have him cut his.🔽He should not do a service for his teacher or have him do a service for him.🔽He should not do a favor for his teacher or have him do a favor for him.

original: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṁ, na ekacco pacchāsamaṇo ādātabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena na ekaccaḥ pacchāsamaṇaḥ ādātabbo
translated: He should not be the attendant monk for his teacher or take on an attendant monk.

original: na ekaccassa piṇḍapāto nīharitabbo, na ekaccena piṇḍapāto nīharāpetabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa piṇḍapātaḥ nīharitabbaḥ na ekaccena piṇḍapātaḥ nīharāpetabbaḥ
translated: He should not bring back almsfood for his teacher or have him bring back almsfood for him.

original: na ācariyaṁ anāpucchā gāmo pavisitabbo;
analyzed: na ācariyam an āpucchā gāmaḥ pavisitabbo
translated: Without asking permission, you shouldn’t enter a village,

original: na susānaṁ gantabbaṁ;
analyzed: na su sānam
translated: go to the charnel ground,

original: na disā pakkamitabbā.🔽Sace ācariyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṁ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṁ.
analyzed: na disā pakkamitabbā  sace ācariyaḥ gilānaḥ hoti yāvajīvam upaṭṭhātabbaḥ vuṭṭhānam assa āgametabba
translated: or leave for a different region.🔽If your teacher is sick, you should nurse him for as long as he lives, or you should wait until he’s recovered.”

original: Idaṁ kho, bhikkhave, antevāsikānaṁ ācariyesu vattaṁ yathā antevāsikehi ācariyesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
analyzed: idam kho bhikkhave antevāsikānam ācariyesu vattam yathā antevāsikehi ācariyesu sammā vattitabbanti
translated: “This is the proper conduct for students in regard to their teachers.”

original: 14. Antevāsikavattakathā
analyzed: antevāsika vatta kathā
translated: . The discussion of proper conduct for students

original: Tena kho pana samayena ācariyā antevāsikesu na sammā vattanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena ācariyāḥ antevāsikesu na sammā vattanti
translated: At that time the teachers were not conducting themselves properly in regard to their students.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma ācariyā antevāsikesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: katham hi nāma ācariyāḥ antevāsikesu na sammā vattissanti iti  atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: “How can teachers not conduct themselves properly in regard to their students?”🔽They told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, ācariyā antevāsikesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave ācariyāḥ antevāsikesu na sammā vattanti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the teachers are not conducting themselves properly in regard to their students?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti …pe…
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati pe
translated: “It’s true, Sir.” …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, ācariyānaṁ antevāsikesu vattaṁ paññapessāmi yathā ācariyehi antevāsikesu sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave ācariyānam antevāsikesu vattam paññapessāmi yathā ācariyehi antevāsikesu sammā vattitabba
translated: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct for teachers toward their pupils.

original: Ācariyena, bhikkhave, antevāsikamhi sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ācariyena bhikkhave antevāsikamhi sammā
translated: A teacher should conduct himself properly toward his pupil.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā
translated: And this is the proper conduct:

original: Ācariyena, bhikkhave, antevāsiko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
analyzed: ācariyena bhikkhave antevāsikaḥ saṅgahetabbaḥ anuggahetabbaḥ uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā
translated: A teacher should support his pupil and look after him, instructing and admonishing him.

original: Sace ācariyassa patto hoti, antevāsikassa patto na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho antevāsikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: sace ācariyassa pattaḥ hoti antevāsikassa pattaḥ na hoti ācariyena antevāsikassa pattaḥ dātabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba  kinti nu kho antevāsikassa pattaḥ uppajjiyetha ati
translated: If the teacher has a bowl and the pupil doesn’t, the teacher should give the pupil the bowl or make an effort to get him one.

original: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ hoti, antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ dātabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa cīvaram hoti antevāsikassa cīvaram na hoti ācariyena antevāsikassa cīvaram dātabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher has a robe and the pupil doesn’t, the teacher should give the pupil the robe or make an effort to get him one.

original: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaram uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my pupil get robe-cloth?’

original: Sace ācariyassa parikkhāro hoti, antevāsikassa parikkhāro na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa parikkhāraḥ hoti antevāsikassa parikkhāraḥ na hoti ācariyena antevāsikassa parikkhāraḥ dātabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher has requisites but the pupil doesn’t, the teacher should give the pupil those requisites or make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa parikkhāraḥ uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my pupil get requisites?’

original: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṁ dātabbaṁ, mukhodakaṁ dātabbaṁ, āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ gilānaḥ hoti kālassa iva uṭṭhāya danta kaṭṭham dātabba mukha udakam dātabba āsanam paññapetabba
translated: If the pupil is sick, the teacher should rise at the appropriate time, prepare a tooth cleaner, and set out water for rinsing the mouth. He should prepare a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṁ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
analyzed: sace yāgu hoti bhājanam dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā
translated: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to the pupil.

original: Yāguṁ pītassa udakaṁ datvā bhājanaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: yāgum pītassa udakam datvā bhājanam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam a paṭigha santena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabba
translated: After the pupil has drunk the rice porridge, the teacher should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

original: Antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba
translated: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace antevāsiko gāmaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, kāyabandhanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.🔽Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ gāmam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti nivāsanam dātabba paṭinivāsanam paṭiggahetabba kāya bandhanam dātabba sa guṇam katvā saṅghāṭiyaḥ dātabbā dhovitvā pattaḥ sa udakaḥ dātabbaḥ  ettāvatā nivattissati iti āsanam pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalika
translated: If the pupil wants to enter the village, he should be given a sarong and a waistband. The upper robes should be made even all around and given to him. The bowl should be washed, dried, and given to him.

original: upanikkhipitabbaṁ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ,
analyzed: upanikkhipitabba paccuggantvā patta cīvaram paṭiggahetabba paṭinivāsanam dātabba
translated: As soon as he has gone, a seat should be prepared for him. Water for washing the feet, a foot stool, and a foot scraper should be set out.🔽After going out to meet him, the bowl and robe should be received from him.

original: nivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: nivāsanam paṭiggahetabba
translated: The sarong should be received from him.

original: Sace cīvaraṁ sinnaṁ hoti, muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbaṁ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṁ nidahitabbaṁ.🔽Cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace cīvaram sinnam hoti muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabba na ca uṇhe cīvaram nidahitabba  cīvaram
translated: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

original: Cīvaraṁ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṁ kaṇṇaṁ ussāretvā cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ—
analyzed: cīvaram saṅgharantena catur aṅgulam kaṇṇam ussāretvā cīvaram
translated: He should fold the robe, making the edges four fingerbreadths apart,

original: mā majjhe bhaṅgo ahosīti.🔽Obhoge kāyabandhanaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: mā majjhe bhaṅgaḥ ahosi iti 🔽obhoge kāyabandhanam
translated: so that the wear lines do not show.🔽He should put the waistband in the fold.

original: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, antevāsiko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṁ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
analyzed: sace piṇḍapātaḥ hoti antevāsikaḥ ca bhuñjitu kāmaḥ hoti udakam datvā piṇḍapātaḥ upanāmetabbo
translated: If there is almsfood and the pupil wants to eat, the teacher should give him water and then the almsfood.

original: Antevāsiko pānīyena pucchitabbo.
analyzed: antevāsikaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo
translated: He should ask the pupil if he wants water to drink.

original: Bhuttāvissa udakaṁ datvā pattaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā vodakaṁ katvā muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
analyzed: bhuttāvissa udakam datvā pattam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena dhovitvā vā udakam katvā muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabbaḥ na ca uṇhe pattaḥ nidahitabbaḥ
translated: After the meal, the teacher should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.🔽Pattaṁ nikkhipantena …pe…
analyzed: patta cīvaram  pattam nikkhipantena pe
translated: He should put away the robe and bowl.🔽When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena …pe…
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena pe
translated: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away.

original: pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram
translated: He should put away the bowl and robe after the pupil.

original: Antevāsikamhi uṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: antevāsikamhi uṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam paṭisāmetabba
translated: When the pupil gets up, the teacher should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.🔽Sace antevāsiko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo  sace antevāsikaḥ nahāyitu kāmaḥ hoti nahānam
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the pupil wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare a bath.

original: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace sītena atthaḥ hoti sītam
translated: If the pupil wants to cool off, he should prepare a cooling-off.

original: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace uṇhena atthaḥ hoti uṇham
translated: If he needs hot water, he should prepare it.

original: Sace antevāsiko jantāgharaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṁ sannetabbaṁ, mattikā temetabbā,
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ jantāgharam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti cuṇṇam sannetabba mattikā temetabbā
translated: If the pupil wants to take a sauna, the preceptor should knead bath powder, moisten the clay,

original: jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṁ datvā cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṁ
analyzed: jantāghara pīṭham ādāya gantvā jantāghara pīṭham da tvā cīvaram paṭiggahetvā ekamanta
translated: take a sauna bench, and go to the sauna. After giving the sauna bench to his pupil, receiving his robe, and putting it aside,

original: nikkhipitabbaṁ, cuṇṇaṁ dātabbaṁ, mattikā dātabbā.
analyzed: nikkhipitabba cuṇṇam dātabba mattikā dātabbā
translated: he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

original: Sace ussahati jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace ussahati jantāgharam
translated: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

original: Jantāgharaṁ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṁ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.🔽Na there bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīditabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharam pavisantena mattikāya mukham makkhetvā puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharam pavisitabba  na there bhikkhū an upakhajja nisīditabba
translated: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover the front and back, and then enter the sauna.🔽He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

original: Na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā.🔽Jantāghare antevāsikassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā  jantāghare antevāsikassa parikammam
translated: nor should he block the junior monks from getting a seat.🔽He should do services for his pupil in the sauna.

original: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāghara pīṭham ādāya puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabba
translated: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover the front and back, and then leave the sauna.

original: Udakepi antevāsikassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.🔽Nahātena paṭhamataraṁ uttaritvā attano gattaṁ vodakaṁ katvā nivāsetvā antevāsikassa
analyzed: udake pi antevāsikassa parikammam  nahātena paṭhamataram uttaritvā attanaḥ gattam vā udakam katvā nivāsetvā antevāsikassa
translated: He should do services for his pupil even in the water.🔽After bathing, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong.

original: gattato udakaṁ pamajjitabbaṁ, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṁ
analyzed: udakam pamajjitabba nivāsanam dātabba saṅghāṭi dātabbā jantāghara pīṭha
translated: He should then wipe the water off his pupil’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench,

original: ādāya paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ
analyzed: ādāya paṭhamataram āgantvā āsanam paññapetabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalika
translated: he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: upanikkhipitabbaṁ, antevāsiko pānīyena pucchitabbo.🔽Yasmiṁ vihāre antevāsiko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
analyzed: upanikkhipitabba antevāsikaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbaḥ  yasmin vihāre antevāsikaḥ viharati sace saḥ vihāraḥ uklāpaḥ hoti sace ussahati sodhetabbo
translated: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.🔽If the dwelling where his pupil is staying is dirty, he should clean it if he’s able.

original: Vihāraṁ sodhentena paṭhamaṁ pattacīvaraṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ …pe…
analyzed: vihāram sodhentena paṭhamam patta cīvaram nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbam pe
translated: When cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

original: ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ āsiñcitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam na hoti ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam
translated: If there is no water in the rinsing pot for the bowl, he should fill it.

original: Sace antevāsikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, ācariyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace antevāsikassa kukkuccaṁ uppannaṁ hoti, ācariyena vinodetabbaṁ, vinodāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti ācariyena vūpakāsetabbaḥ vūpakāsāpetabbaḥ dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace antevāsikassa kukkuccam uppannam hoti ācariyena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If the pupil is discontent, the teacher should allay it or make an effort to have it allayed. If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation, the teacher should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha grant my pupil probation?’

original: Sace antevāsikassa diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti, ācariyena vivecetabbaṁ, vivecāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace antevāsiko garudhammaṁ ajjhāpanno hoti, parivāsāraho, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa parivāsaṁ dadeyyāti.🔽Sace antevāsiko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa diṭṭhi gatam uppannam hoti ācariyena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace antevāsikaḥ garu dhammam ajjhāpannaḥ hoti parivāsa ārahaḥ ācariyena ussukkam kātabba  kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikassa parivāsam dadeyya ati  sace antevāsikaḥ mūlāya paṭikassana arahaḥ hoti ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning, the teacher should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha send my pupil back to the beginning?’🔽If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period, the teacher should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha grant my pupil the trial period?’

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṁ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.🔽Sace antevāsiko mānattāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikam mūlāya paṭikasseyya ati 🔽sace antevāsikaḥ mānatta arahaḥ hoti ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil deserves to be rehabilitated, the teacher should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha grant my pupil rehabilitation?’

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa mānattaṁ dadeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikassa mānattam dadeyya ati
translated: ‘How can the Sangha give the trial period to my pupil?’

original: Sace antevāsiko abbhānāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ hoti ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil deserves rehabilitation, the teacher should make an effort,
